EmailTemplate.subject: Modern Data Architecture for IT Transformation
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Week of July 13, 2015 <http://pivotal.io/big-data/webinar/modern-data-architecture-for-it-transformation?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> Pivotal HAWQ and Hortonworks Data Platform: Modern Data Architecture for IT Transformation Join us on July 22nd at 10:00 AM PST / 5:00 PM GMT to learn how Pivotal HAWQ <http://pivotal.io/big-data/pivotal-hawq?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15>, one of the world’s most advanced enterprise SQL on Hadoop <http://pivotal.io/big-data/hadoop/sql-on-hadoop?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> technology, coupled with the Hortonworks Data Platform <http://hortonworks.com/hdp/>, the only 100% open source Apache Hadoop data platform, can turbocharge your analytic efforts. Featuring a massively-parallel processing (MPP) SQL query engine that runs directly in the compute resources of a Hadoop cluster, Pivotal HAWQ and the Hortonworks Data Platform provide businesses with a Modern Data Architecture for analytics and data science.
Attend this session to learn about this powerful technology, including:
- A brief history of MPP SQL and Pivotal HAWQ - Architecture and use cases for SQL on Hadoop - Technical deep dive of features and integration with the Hortonworks Data Platform - Quick demo of analytical features REGISTER <http://pivotal.io/big-data/webinar/modern-data-architecture-for-it-transformation?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> All About Diego and Lattice July 15, 2015 What are Diego and Lattice, and how does it fit into Cloud Foundry? This week's Pivotal Conversations podcast dives into how these two core components of Cloud Foundry evolved, and what they do for your apps running on Cloud Foundry. As you can tell, Lattice gets kids and dogs really, really excited and we think you’ll start yelling about it too after listening.
Listen Now <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-conversations/features/all-about-diego-and-lattice?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> How Verizon Drives Enterprise Transformation With Pivotal Cloud Foundry July 13, 2015 During a presentation at the Cloud Foundry Summit, Verizon’s Siki Giunta outlined how cloud technologies can drive enterprise transformation. Enterprises currently allocate the bulk of resources—budget and personnel—to maintenance projects, and only a small percentage of resources to transformational projects. Consequently, they are beleaguered by sluggish innovation and missed market opportunities. According to Giunta, cloud technologies, and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) in particular, can significantly address this state of affairs.
Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/case-studies-2/how-verizon-drives-enterprise-transformation-with-pivotal-cloud-foundry?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> Ambitious Apps at Amazing Scale: Submit to the Apache Geode Hackathon July 08, 2015 It’s not too late to create a submission for the Ambitious Apps at Amazing Scale Hackathon for Apache Geode, the open source version of Pivotal GemFire. Apache Geode, which powers some of the world’s most demanding applications, was recently accepted by The Apache Software Foundation as an incubating project. To celebrate this adoption by the Apache Software Foundation, Pivotal Software is challenging developers to learn more about its capabilities. Participants in the Apache Geode hackathon have a chance to win over $1500 in prizes.
Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/news-2/ambitious-apps-at-amazing-scale-submit-to-the-apache-geode-hackathon?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-7-15-15> VISIT OUR P.O.V.
